title: Can we get some tank items with movement speed?
body:
I'm not talking about boots just other items giving movement speed. It's pretty much only offensive items that give MS: trinity force, PD, Shiv, Zephyr, lichbane, etc. Talisman gives no tank stats, the closest things are Phage which doesn't even build into a defensive option anymore and Righteous Glory which is just an active. 

Why do champs that build damage get to itemize MS while still getting damage, most ADCs have escapes and supports peeling for them do they really need better MS options as well. Almost every ADC played now has self peel, would it be so bad if sunfire cape had some MS on it. Force of Nature could be brought back too.

replies.body:
> [{quoted}](name=Hi Im Brad,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=pZFlwtfu,comment-id=0001,timestamp=2015-02-22T18:55:04.499+0000)
>
> force of nature :((((((((((((((((((((((((((((((((((((((((

THE DREAM
Leviathan
Heart of Gold
As a tank, I don't miss Madred's Bloodrazors though.
We need it more than ever
That was instantly my thought when I read the title. RIP FoN...
Having a tank item with the phantom dancer passive would be cool too.
Cho'gath, Zac, Sejuani and all the ones that get stuck in the minions would be hella grateful...

Oh man, tank items with movement speed? Will {{champion:27}} {{champion:33}} {{champion:86}}  ACTUALLY BE ABLE TO CATCH SOMEONE? Nah, rito wont do this because increase movement speed isnt {{summoner:4}}y enough.
The fact you just said that singed, rammus, and garen can't catch people is disturbing.
disturbingly true...  singed can hardly catch shit in the mobility meta.
Exactly. Singed Garen and Rammus cant go through walls. every 10 seconds (or more)
{{champion:429}}
{{champion:76}} prebugfix was still more op
Speaking of bugfixes, anyone remember that glitch where when Rengar would walk into a bush, he'd be permanently stealthed once he walked out until he attacked a target?

{{item:3800}} ,but I agree with that it doesn't really fit the bill.

Tank MS item BUMP!

> [{quoted}](name=PeanutButterJely,realm=EUNE,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=pZFlwtfu,comment-id=0002,timestamp=2015-02-22T18:55:04.144+0000)
>
> {{item:3800}} ,but I agree with that it doesn't really fit the bill.
> 
> Tank MS item BUMP!

It's not a item you would want to have on Garen. And that guy is in riddiculus spot right now  - sure he can still handle 1v1 lane with old champions, but the new ones are made the way that he is completly outshined.

rip {{item:3143}} .
MS slow removed cuz tanks are meant to be poked against({{item:3035}} {{item:3153}} ) and not be able to do anything about it, but take it like a boss. and heal it all off.. somehow.

I think a reason we may not have any tanky MS items is because ideally, tanks and bruisers are so tanky that they don't need the movement speed because they won't die while getting to their target, but the current strength of Last Whisper and Void Staff means that tanks and bruisers will die almost as fast as their pure damage counterparts if they don't have some kind of obscene form of damage reduction like Sion's infinite health stacking or the % damage reduction from the likes of Maokai or Alistar (and when I say obscene, I mean that they survive as long as a tank should in a teamfight, not that the damage reduction itself is inappropriately strong).

In addition, I feel like Righteous Glory is more than appropriate for tanky movement speed, because all of the situations that you want movement speed are either situations where you want to roam or you want to engage. Righteous Glory perfectly fills the latter role while you can easily fit Mobility Boots or Boots of Swiftness into your build as a tank without dramatically affecting how much damage you can tank if you want to roam a bit.

Don't forget we also have the Point Runner passive on Raptor Cloak and its upgrades, which gives a situational movement speed boost. Not what we are looking for in a tanky MS item, but still worth pointing out.

That said, I personally would LOVE a tanky movement speed item. I'm just not sure how appropriate it would be for the game though.
Except that the Raptor Cloak items are extremely situational, whereas the other classes have access to MS boosting items that work all the time, everywhere on the map.

> [{quoted}](name=Kamquats,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=pZFlwtfu,comment-id=0004,timestamp=2015-02-22T19:31:56.925+0000)
>
> I think a reason we may not have any tanky MS items is because ideally, tanks and bruisers are so tanky that they don't need the movement speed because they won't die while getting to their target, but the current strength of Last Whisper and Void Staff means that tanks and bruisers will die almost as fast as their pure damage counterparts if they don't have some kind of obscene form of damage reduction like Sion's infinite health stacking or the % damage reduction from the likes of Maokai or Alistar (and when I say obscene, I mean that they survive as long as a tank should in a teamfight, not that the damage reduction itself is inappropriately strong).
> 
> In addition, I feel like Righteous Glory is more than appropriate for tanky movement speed, because all of the situations that you want movement speed are either situations where you want to roam or you want to engage. Righteous Glory perfectly fills the latter role while you can easily fit Mobility Boots or Boots of Swiftness into your build as a tank without dramatically affecting how much damage you can tank if you want to roam a bit.
> 
> Don't forget we also have the Point Runner passive on Raptor Cloak and its upgrades, which gives a situational movement speed boost. Not what we are looking for in a tanky MS item, but still worth pointing out.
> 
> That said, I personally would LOVE a tanky movement speed item. I'm just not sure how appropriate it would be for the game though.

I thought it was more about the preconception of a tank as a slow thing.  while there isn't a whole lot of reason to assume that a tanky guy couldn't also be a fast guy, I think what we see is a prevalence of preconceived symbolic complexes concerning the types of uses for champions.  While not everyone at riot does that,  there are a fair bit who do.

> preconception of a tank as a slow thing.

Captain Tankmo, reporting for duty!
How about a tank item with PDs passive?

Force of Nature was deemed OP for the very fact that it was a defensive movespeed item.

While I personally feel that is pretty dumb reason... I'm not Morello.

So... nope.jpg

No, it was a defensive item with passive mobility.  The key word is "passive".  There are defensive items with active mobility, though that's kind of like saying Hourglass is a defensive item.

(Mercurial Scimitar and Dervish Blade)

I actually went back to find Xyph's reasoning. 
---
Basically, he felt that boots should be the "mobility item" for everyone, and attaching it to certain stats meant only "niche people" wanted all those stats at once. He seemed to be talking more in favor of the HP/5 (forgot they were on a real anti-regen kick back then), but also touched on how it was "unhealthy for itemization to be forced to buy stats that not everyone wanted just for the MS". He also went on a stat by stat comparison of the various reasons that people picked up FoN, and why they were bad ideas to pick up FoN, usually cost effectiveness. 

The fact that the pro's were still prioritizing it over other MR buy's was baffling to them, as it just wasn't cost effective for the MR increase. The fact that MS only existed on an MR item made it difficult to balance Magic damage around the fact that everyone who wanted the MS was also picking up a decent chunk of MR. He saw the Regen passive as the only legit reason to pick it up, but felt that another item should be the "regen" buy over FoN as it meshed poorly with MR and MS (which is hilarious because he wanted to put it on SV).
---
That said, most tanks don't really feel mana gives them enough of anything for their buck, and is almost seen as wasted gold on most of them as it doesn't necessarily make you live longer. Not to mention that there are tanks that can't use the mana at all. So they never really solved the problem as I have never thought "you know what I need? More mana" on any tank other than singed or Galio, and even then, I would rather pick up chalice on Galio.

Also, for how much you spend on Righteous Glory I would save a little more and rather pick up a Randuin's omen for health/AoE Slow, or a Frozen heart if I really wanted mana, or a Warmongs if I really did want just the health and regen. There is no value I get from Righteous glory outside the active MS Buff, and even then I would rather pick up Talisman of Ascension as It's FAR cheaper and I can use it to help my team escape, not to mention has better regen and passive MS on top of the active.
---
Tl;dr- the same logic they used to remove FoN can apply to {{item:3800}}. {{item:3069}} is the only passive MS item outside of boots that tanks would really want, and it is better in every sense outside of providing HP. So either we already have it if we count the Talisman, or we aren't allowed it. because Riot Consistancy.

[Sauce](http://www.surrenderat20.net/2012/12/xypherous-talks-about-force-of-natures.html)

Ugh, I remember this. 

I still think the guy's a total jackass for this.

Thing is, Talisman of Ascension doesn't really provide combat stats that tanks would want. All they would effectively be getting out of it over Righteous Glory is 10% cooldown reduction, +20 movement speed, and some passive gold regeneration, and Righteous Glory's 500 health is easily better on a tank. In addition, Righteous Glory's build path is a lot better than Talisman's on anyone that isn't a support, and the active is strictly better in any situation that where you are not trying to disengage.

Obviously Talisman has its place, but not on a tank that is trying to engage.

Eh, I don't know about that. The only things that righteous glory has over Talisman is the HP and the AoE slow at the end, and frankly If that is what you want then, as I said, Randuin's is better. And beleive it or not, Talisman is good on just about anyone outside of junglers. Outside of that, I don't see any reason why a tank *wouldn't* pick up an early Nomad's Medalian and finish it later, especially if having to be passive in lane due to circumstances or feeling a little mana hungry in the early game.

That said, this kinda ties into my previous point. Righteous Glory exists in a very similar spot to Force of Nature, especially considering the reasons that it was removed. Plus, Righteous glory only gives you MS in immediate engage situations. All other situations, including the active being on cooldown, Talisman gives you more MS for your buck. And even then, considering cost effectiveness, the MS on Talisman is more gold efficient than on Righteous Glory.

The MS boost on Righteous Glory is stronger than that on Talisman of Ascension when engaging. In addition, the MS slow on Rightous Glory is twice as strong as that of Randuin's Omen for half of the duration.

This also doesn't take into account that Rightous Glory and both items in its build path give actual stats. Catalyst gives combat stats. Bracer gives combat stats. Compare that to Talisman. Medallion doesn't give combat stats, and Idol only gives CDR.

This also doesn't account for the fact that you can buy the passive MS boost that Talisman gives on a boot enchant, so the passive MS doesn't really make it that much better than the lack of it on Righteous Glory.

>The MS boost on Righteous Glory is stronger than that on Talisman of Ascension when engaging. In addition, the MS slow on Rightous Glory is twice as strong as that of Randuin's Omen for half of the duration.

Except when calculating the total MS in the boost, you have to also add Talisman's extra MS stat in before the boost, causing them to be about even. As for the slow, Randuin's has a scaling duration and lasts longer. So... again about even. considering league of Gapclosers, I could even argue that Randuin's increased duration helps more, as the more mobile can simply create a second's worth of distance with almost any hop that isn't flash *and even then...*

>This also doesn't take into account that Rightous Glory and both items in its build path give actual stats. Catalyst gives combat stats. Bracer gives combat stats. Compare that to Talisman. Medallion doesn't give combat stats, and Idol only gives CDR.

Today I learned that Regen isn't a stat. Better buff Mundo then as apparantly his stats are meaningless from his ult. =P

I could definitely argue that Regen is a combat stat. I could also mention that with the cheaper price, you could easily buy the HP that isn't in talisman, especially when considering the passive gold that alot of tanks like. Over all, If you are buying this for the combat stats, you go ahead and pick up randuin's. If you are buying it for the MS, pick up Talisman as well. This is the same reason that FoN got removed and the point you seem to be ignoring. Other items perform better for whatever reason you pick up Righteous glory. Just like back in the past, FoN was outclassed in every way outside of it's passive regen. Btw Warmogs has that passive now, so Righteous glory really has no ground left.

>This also doesn't account for the fact that you can buy the passive MS boost that Talisman gives on a boot enchant, so the passive MS doesn't really make it that much better than the lack of it on Righteous Glory.

I didn't count for the fact that I could enchant my boots because it is irrelevant. The boost in the boots can stack with Talisman just as easily as with Righteous glory. Which means that you are still faster with Talisman outside of initiations, while initiations still come out around the same..

Saying Health Regen is a combat stat and using Mundo's ult as an example is straight up wrong.

Mundo's ultimate heals a % of his health over time for a few seconds. He's regenerating his health, but it's not health regen that he gets out of his ult.

The reason I said that Health Regen wasn't a combat stat was that because it makes such little of a difference in a fight that its impact in a fight is negligible. However, after a fight it does have some impact by bringing your health back up. It's like saying Health Potions give you combat stats.

I feel like you have a lot of good points, though. I do feel that Rightous Glory has its place, but Talisman does seem kind of better.

>The reason I said that Health Regen wasn't a combat stat was that because it makes such little of a difference in a fight that its impact in a fight is negligible. However, after a fight it does have some impact by bringing your health back up. It's like saying Health Potions give you combat stats.

While granted, during a full out fight it isn't that valuable, in pokes it's pretty helpful as well as after a huge teamfight, when the tank would naturally be low, he can still participate in the push if still alive. I would say that even without using mundo as an example, Heimer's passive (this got translated into his actual regen stat btw) was  a great boon to him as he got a little health back between every lane, allowing him to poke FAR longer than other champs and truly be a seige based champ.

This doesn't make my point wrong. It was pretty much a must buy every game for anyone with meat on their bones. The only reason that the active {{item:3800}} isn't is because there are better health based items today that slow the enemy team down ({{item:3143}}). There were not better MR items for tanks back in that day. Heck, I bet FoN would still outclass the MR items of today. It was *that* good, and no amount of price raising or stat lowering would change that. Tanks tend to not want to buy mana, otherwise you would see more {{item:3102}} and {{item:3800}}.

>There are defensive items with active mobility, though that's kind of like saying Hourglass is a defensive item.

I'm so confused, halp. How is hourglass in this argument? How does it give you mobility? How does that mobility make it defensive? So confused.
For Hourglass, it means that it's only devensive by its active, althought this is wrong since it also has 50 armor. I mainly buy it for that reason, in fact.

I was referring to the point made by the previous poster about active mobility and zhonya's hourglass.

Re-reading, I see what he means, but damn did that come out confusing as hell. Zhonya's is an offensive item with defensive perks, not a defensive offensive item. Similarly Righteous Glory is a Defensive item with a mobility perk, not a mobility defensive item.

Yep.  I was comparing Hourglass's active to Mercurial Scimitar and Dervish Blade.  All three items are big offensive items, yet have defensive stats.  You could argue that Bloodthirster is similar because of its shield.

But of Mercurial Scimitar and Dervish Blade, they have an active mobility effect, which I think Riot promotes.  Riot does not, however, seem to like promoting passive mobility effects, outside boots and offensive items (Zephyr, PD, Shiv).

The reasoning I think is that ***Riot believes mobility is a defense***, so you will never see mobility on a defensive item, unless, the mobility came at a cost.  This gives some hope to Force of Nature, or a similar item, to being used, because it trades health and healing/spellshield, for mobility and health regen.  And all honestly, there needs to be a MR counterpart to Thornmail ...

All major defensive items have health, with exception of Frozen Heart and Archangel.  I wouldn't call Hourglass, Abyssal, or Athenes "Defensive" items.

>All major defensive items have health, with exception of Frozen Heart and Archangel. I wouldn't call Hourglass, Abyssal, or Athenes "Defensive" items.

Not necessarily.

Archangel is an offensive item with a sheild if you max it. Nice, but not a defensive item.

Also, as a few counterpoints, Gaurdian Angel is nothing but resistances, and I must say that it qualifies. Likewise, ZZ'rot also has HP/5 and resists, but no HP. I would say this counts as a defensive item as well. If you try to tell me Thornmail isn't a defensive item, I'll laugh.

HP does not make something a defensive item either. For example, Trinity force is known for the term "Tons of Damage" but it has health in it. Same with liandries torment.

HP is a defensive stat. However, it isn't what makes a defensive item.
tank meta boring, not lcsbigplays enough, never happen

I don't know. *Can* you?

/le annoying english teacher
with your use of *le* I assume you are imitating a rage comic and instantly hate you >:(

Alright, so I absolutely love playing tanks, and it's probably my strongest power fantasy in the game is to just be an un-killable force of zoning and peel for my carries.  It's just so damn satisfying and one of the things that can really ruin that experience is getting kited and ignored because you can't keep up with the action.  Nothing like having my ad carry dash or blink over a wall, and an assassin follow him, and I have no way to follow up the action and keep my boys safe.

But, am I the only one terrified of the consequences of move speed on a defensive item?  We all know a champ like irelia will end up abusing this item comboed with tri-force, and then it'll get nerfed into irrelevance for tanks, or worse yet, tanks will somehow get nerfed with a convoluted context in the patch notes from rito.

They would have to be really careful with an item like this.  Possibly removing tri-force's MS boost and making it a unique passive that's shared with this item, I dunno, but I just really feel like this item is just screaming to get abused.

I mean, hell, that's probably *part* of why things like force of nature (peace be upon it, and may god go with it) has been ripped away from us so callously.

tl;dr 11/10 do want this item, but also 11/10 concerned that this would turn into an abuse case and tanks would somehow get nerfed as compensation.
You could pair it with stats tanks would benefit from like % increases in armor, health, MR. You could make the MS bonus low but increase when near allies, or make it scale with bonus armor/MR.
There are ways to get this to work, sadly most of those ways involve doing things Riot seems to not like doing.

X Item:

+50 armor
+50 magic resistance
+5% movement speed

Passive: Nearby enemy casts generate a stack of X. (Stacks up to 20 times)
Active: Consumes all stacks of X to restore 15 health and 10 mana per stack.
Did somebody say Magic Wand?
Maybe, but just Maybe, I copied this item from another MOBA.
Moonflair Spellblade RITO PLEASE!!!!!!!!!!!
Imo we need some REALLY strong item for melee AP tanks. Nemezis mode proves, that those are in terrible spot right now.
